page.title: 07WELCOME TO ASPULL
page.content: This area is situated at the edge of the foothills of the{Pennines}and overlooks{Wigan}in the{River Douglas {valley.} {Agriculture}dominates this area, mostly dairy and stock farming, with crops being grown mainly for feeding the livestock. Until the Inter-War Depression, industries were established around the main village of{Aspull,}including{malt {kilns, cotton mills and coal mines,} the latter leaving many examples of its working life. The last working pit closed in the 1920's. One of the pleasant sights within and around the village is the presence of large parcels of{common land.}
